SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Level.LevelManager

Class CleanDestroyedManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Level.LevelManager.CleanDestroyedManager
public class CleanDestroyedManager extends Object
Manages the cleanup of destroyed actors in the game, removing them from the scene when they go out of bounds or are marked as destroyed.

This class handles the removal of various types of actors (e.g., projectiles, ammo boxes, hearts) from the game scene when they either go out of bounds or are destroyed. It ensures that destroyed or out-of-bounds actors are efficiently cleaned up, reducing memory usage and preventing unnecessary updates to inactive objects.

The class interacts with the ActiveActorManager to retrieve the lists of actors and uses the boundaries to check whether they need to be removed.

See Also:
  • ActiveActorDestructible
  • Boundary

  • Field Details

    • root

      private final javafx.scene.Group root
      The root group where all the game actors are displayed in the scene. This is a JavaFX container that holds the visual representation of all actors.
      See Also:
      • Group

    • activeActorManager

      private final ActiveActorManager activeActorManager
      The manager responsible for managing all active actors in the game. This includes actors such as projectiles, units, ammo boxes, and hearts. It provides methods for accessing and manipulating these actors.
      See Also:
      • ActiveActorManager

  • Constructor Details

      public CleanDestroyedManager(javafx.scene.Group root, ActiveActorManager activeActorManager)
      Constructs an instance of CleanDestroyedManager.
      Parameters:
      root - the root Group where the actors are displayed
      activeActorManager - the manager responsible for managing active actors

  • Method Details

    • cleanObj

      public void cleanObj()
      Cleans up objects that are outside the boundaries or destroyed. This method removes user projectiles, enemy projectiles, ammo boxes, and hearts if they are out of bounds or destroyed.
      See Also:
      • cleanObjects(List, List, List, List, Boundary, Boundary, Consumer)

    • cleanObjects

      public void cleanObjects(List<ActiveActorDestructible> userProjectiles, List<ActiveActorDestructible> enemyProjectiles, List<ActiveActorDestructible> ammoBoxes, List<ActiveActorDestructible> hearts, Boundary rightBoundary, Boundary leftBoundary, Consumer<ActiveActorDestructible> removeActorFromScene)
      Cleans up various types of game objects, removing them from the scene if they are destroyed or out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      userProjectiles - the list of user projectiles to clean
      enemyProjectiles - the list of enemy projectiles to clean
      ammoBoxes - the list of ammo boxes to clean
      hearts - the list of hearts to clean
      rightBoundary - the boundary on the right side of the screen
      leftBoundary - the boundary on the left side of the screen
      removeActorFromScene - a function that removes an actor from the scene when necessary
      See Also:
      • cleanList(List, Boundary, Consumer)
      • cleanList(List, Boundary, Boundary, Consumer)

    • cleanList

      private void cleanList(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors, Boundary boundary, Consumer<ActiveActorDestructible> removeActorFromScene)
      Cleans a list of actors by removing them from the scene if they collide with a given boundary.
      Parameters:
      actors - the list of actors to clean
      boundary - the boundary to check against
      removeActorFromScene - a function that removes an actor from the scene when necessary

    • cleanList

      private void cleanList(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors, Boundary boundary1, Boundary boundary2, Consumer<ActiveActorDestructible> removeActorFromScene)
      Cleans a list of actors by removing them from the scene if they collide with either of two boundaries.
      Parameters:
      actors - the list of actors to clean
      boundary1 - the first boundary to check against
      boundary2 - the second boundary to check against
      removeActorFromScene - a function that removes an actor from the scene when necessary

    • checkCollision

      private boolean checkCollision(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rect1, Boundary boundary)
      Checks if the given rectangle (hitbox) intersects with the specified boundary.
      Parameters:
      rect1 - the rectangle to check for intersection
      boundary - the boundary to check against
      Returns:
      true if the rectangle intersects with the boundary, false otherwise

    • processActor

      private void processActor(ActiveActorDestructible actor, Consumer<ActiveActorDestructible> removeActorFromScene)
      Processes an actor that is out of bounds or destroyed, triggering its destruction and removing it from the scene.
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor to process
      removeActorFromScene - a function that removes the actor from the scene

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      public void removeAllDestroyedActors()
